metadata.synopsis: Leaving her rural life in Arkansas, Shirlee Kenyon (Dolly Parton) moves to Chicago and seeks employment at a radio station. When a mix-up finds Shirlee sitting in as the host on a show for call-in advice, her common-sense wisdom wins over fans. Soon she's "Doctor Shirlee," an in-demand on-air personality, but, of course, she's lacking in the proper credentials, a fact that journalist Jack Russell (James Woods) already suspects. Will Shirlee be able to keep her new gig if the truth gets out?

reviews: Cute little romcom with the always likable Dolly Parton
Listening to all her callers didn't do the trick for me. I left the cinema feeling more depressed than ever.
...an agreeable yet hopelessly forgettable little romcom.
Dolly Parton's immense likablity makes this very slight film an amiable watch.
Dolly does Chicago -- and not much else.

What's really wrong with Straight Talk is a failure of nerve. The screenplay is so painfully conventional that it's clear nobody involved with the movie wanted to push it into new ground or let it take chances.
